00024     : optimalThreshold_(0), backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_(255),
00025     noiseRemovalTime_(0.0), optimalThresholdComputingTime_(0.0), backgroundReferenceGrayLevelFindingTime_(0.0)

00036 const unsigned char &Preprocessor::computeOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip, const unsigned int &technique)
00037 {
00038     if ( technique == 0 )
00039         computeSonkaOptimalThreshold (clip);
00040     else
00041         computeOtsuOptimalThreshold (clip);
00042     
00043     return optimalThreshold_;
00044 };

00056 const unsigned char &Preprocessor::findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel (const Clip &clip, const unsigned int &referenceGrayLevelNeighbours)
00057 {
00058     // Start timing
00059     boost::timer timer;
00060     timer.restart();
00061     
00062     
00063     // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00064     std::vector<unsigned char> pixels = clip.pixels();
00065     
00066     
00067     // Compute clip histogram
00068     std::vector<unsigned int> histogram(256, 0);
00069     std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator;
00070     
00071     for ( pixelsIterator = pixels.begin(); pixelsIterator not_eq pixels.end(); ++pixelsIterator )
00072         histogram[static_cast<unsigned int>(*pixelsIterator)] += 1;
00073     
00074         
00075     // Search the more frequent level of gray
00076     std::vector<unsigned int>::iterator histogramIterator;
00077     unsigned int moreFrequentGrayLevel = 0;
00078     unsigned int maximumAppearances = histogram[0];
00079     
00080     for ( unsigned int l = 1; l < 256; ++l )
00081     {
00082         if ( histogram[l] > maximumAppearances )
00083         {
00084             moreFrequentGrayLevel   = l;
00085             maximumAppearances      = histogram[l];
00086         }
00087     }
00088     unsigned int referenceGrayLevel = moreFrequentGrayLevel * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00089 
00090 
00091     // Search the neighbours of the more frequent level of gray
00092     std::vector<unsigned int>::reverse_iterator histogramReverseIterator( std::find (histogram.rbegin(), histogram.rend(), histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel])++ );
00093     histogramIterator = histogramReverseIterator.base()++;
00094     unsigned int nFrequencies = histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00095 
00096     for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= referenceGrayLevelNeighbours; ++i )
00097     {
00098         // Search forwards
00099         if ( histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end() )
00100         {
00101             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel + i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00102             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00103 
00104             ++histogramIterator;
00105         }
00106 
00107         // Search backwards
00108         if ( histogramReverseIterator not_eq histogram.rend() )
00109         {
00110             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel - i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00111             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00112 
00113             ++histogramReverseIterator;
00114         }
00115     }
00116 
00117     // Set the background reference gray level found
00118     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = static_cast<unsigned char>( round(referenceGrayLevel / nFrequencies) );
00119     
00120     // Gather elapsed time
00121     backgroundReferenceGrayLevelFindingTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00122 
00123     return backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00124 };

00132 void Preprocessor::removeIsolatedNoise (Clip &clip, const unsigned int &isolationCoefficient)
00133 {
00134     // Start timing
00135     boost::timer timer;
00136     timer.restart();
00137     
00138     
00139     // Loop over the clip to remove every noisy isolated pixel
00140     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00141     {
00142         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00143         {
00144             unsigned char pixelGrayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(i, j);
00145             
00146             // Comparison values to avoid pixels that clearly belong to the background
00147             bool backgroundPixelOnWhite = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) and (pixelGrayLevel >= backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00148             bool backgroundPixelOnBlack = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (pixelGrayLevel <= backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00149             
00150             if ( not backgroundPixelOnBlack and not backgroundPixelOnWhite )
00151             {
00152                 unsigned int nBackgroundPixels = 0, nPixels = 0;
00153 
00154                 // Explore the pixel neighbourhood
00155                 for(int p = i-1; p < static_cast<int>(i+2); p++)
00156                 {
00157                     for(int q = j-1; q < static_cast<int>(j+2); q++)
00158                     {
00159                         // Comparison values to avoid step outside the image and the central pixel
00160                         bool heightOverflow = (p < 0) or (p >= static_cast<int>(clip.height()));
00161                         bool widthOverflow  = (q < 0) or (q >= static_cast<int>(clip.width()));
00162                         bool isCentralPixel = (p == static_cast<int>(i)) and (q == static_cast<int>(j));
00163                         
00164                         if ( not heightOverflow and not widthOverflow and not isCentralPixel )
00165                         {
00166                             // Update pixels counter
00167                             nPixels++;
00168 
00169                             // Get neighbour pixel gray level
00170                             unsigned char neighbourPixelGrayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(p, q);
00171 
00172                             // When background gray level is close to white but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00173                             if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ >= optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel >= optimalThreshold_) )
00174                                 nBackgroundPixels++;
00175                             else
00176                             {
00177                                 // When background gray level is close to black but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00178                                 if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel <= optimalThreshold_) )
00179                                     nBackgroundPixels++;
00180                             }
00181                         }
00182                     }
00183                 }
00184 
00185                 // Clear the noisy pixel if it is isolated
00186                 if (nBackgroundPixels >= (nPixels - isolationCoefficient))
00187                     clip.setPixelGrayLevel(i, j, backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00188             }
00189         }
00190     }
00191     
00192     // Gather elapsed time
00193     noiseRemovalTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00194 };

00202 void Preprocessor::computeSonkaOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip)
00203 {
00204     // Start timing
00205     boost::timer timer;
00206     timer.restart();
00207     
00208     // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00209     std::vector<unsigned char> pixels = clip.pixels();
00210     
00211     
00212     // Start with an initial threshold
00213     optimalThreshold_ = backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00214     unsigned char currentThreshold = not optimalThreshold_; // Enforces current threshold to be different so the firts loop is always made
00215     
00216     
00217     // Loop as many times as needed to find the optimal threshold by averaging the pixel gray levels
00218     while (currentThreshold not_eq optimalThreshold_)
00219     {
00220         unsigned int backgroundMeanValue = 0, objectsMeanValue = 0;
00221         unsigned int nSamples = 0;
00222         
00223         std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator;
00224         
00225         // Compute the background and objects mean values
00226         for ( pixelsIterator = pixels.begin(); pixelsIterator not_eq pixels.end(); ++pixelsIterator )
00227         {
00228             unsigned char grayLevel = *pixelsIterator;
00229             
00230             if ( grayLevel >= optimalThreshold_ )
00231             {
00232                 backgroundMeanValue += grayLevel;
00233                 nSamples++;
00234             }
00235             else
00236                 objectsMeanValue += grayLevel;
00237         }
00238         backgroundMeanValue = round(backgroundMeanValue / nSamples);
00239         objectsMeanValue = round(objectsMeanValue / (clip.nPixels() - nSamples));
00240 
00241 
00242         // Update the optimal threshold keeping the last one
00243         currentThreshold = optimalThreshold_;
00244         optimalThreshold_ = static_cast<unsigned char>( round((objectsMeanValue + backgroundMeanValue) / 2) );
00245     }
00246     
00247     // Gather elapsed time
00248     optimalThresholdComputingTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00249 };

00251 
00259 void Preprocessor::computeOtsuOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip)
00260 {
00261     // Start timing
00262     boost::timer timer;
00263     timer.restart();
00264     
00265     // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00266     std::vector<unsigned char> pixels   = clip.pixels();
00267     
00268     
00272     std::vector<double> histogram(256,0.0);
00273     std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator;
00274     
00275     for ( pixelsIterator = pixels.begin(); pixelsIterator not_eq pixels.end(); ++pixelsIterator )
00276         histogram[static_cast<int>(*pixelsIterator)] += 1.0;
00277     
00278     double nPixels = static_cast<double>( clip.nPixels() );
00279     std::transform (histogram.begin(), histogram.end(), histogram.begin(), std::bind2nd(std::divides<double>(), nPixels) );
00280     
00281     
00285     double meanGrayLevel = 0.0;
00286     for ( unsigned int k = 1; k <= 256; ++k )
00287         meanGrayLevel += histogram[k-1] * static_cast<double>(k);
00288         
00289     
00294     std::vector<double> omega(256,0.0);
00295     std::vector<double> mu(256,0.0);
00296     for ( unsigned int k = 0; k < 256; ++k )
00297     {
00298         for ( unsigned int i = 0; i <= k; ++i )
00299         {
00300             omega[k]    += histogram[i];
00301             mu[k]       += histogram[i] * static_cast<double>(i+1) ;
00302         }
00303     }
00304     
00305     
00309     std::vector<double> sigma(256,0.0);
00310     for ( unsigned int k = 0; k < 256; ++k )
00311     {
00312         double numerator    = (meanGrayLevel * omega[k]) - mu[k];
00313         double denominator  = omega[k] - (1.0 - omega[k]);
00314         
00315         sigma[k] = pow(numerator, 2) / denominator;
00316     }
00317     
00318     
00322     optimalThreshold_ = 0;
00323     double maximumSigma = sigma[0];
00324     for ( unsigned int k = 1; k < 256; ++k )
00325     {
00326         if ( sigma[k] > maximumSigma )
00327         {
00328             maximumSigma        = sigma[k];
00329             optimalThreshold_   = static_cast<unsigned char>(k);
00330         }
00331     }
00332     
00333     // Gather elapsed time
00334     optimalThresholdComputingTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00335 };
